Description: Wall fragment of pottery open vase? Fine, light red (2.5 YR 6/6) clay with a few fragments of silver mica. Exterior: glaze fired mainly red (2.5 YR 4/8); below, two grooves with added white fill; above, wavy incised ivy tendrils with white berries. Interior has dark brown (7.5 YR 3/2) glaze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Piekarski erroneously takes this to be from an amphora.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p.51, no. D29, pl. 25, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ID.020)
